data.title: 2 Social stocks: Facebook & Snap
data.text: The "Fast Money" traders give you 4 buys in the social stocks after Snap surges following their summit today.

data.title: Investors are increasingly comfortable with Facebook's regulatory risk, says analyst
data.text: Michael Morris of Guggenheim Securities joins CNBC's "Power Lunch" team to talk about Snap's growth plan and the firm's new buy rating on Facebook.

data.title: Guggenheim Upgrades Facebook As Investors 'Gain Comfort' With Content, Privacy Concerns
data.text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) investors appear to have gained "comfort" with the multiple content and privacy concerns, Guggenheim says in a new note.

data.title: FANG Stocks Flying As Nirvana Spreads In The Tech Sector
data.text: The NYSE FANG+ Index ($NYFANG) is up more than 3 percent since Friday, putting it on pace for the biggest weekly gain since early January.

data.title: McNamee: Zuckerberg is trying to absolve Facebook of responsibility
data.text: Roger McNamee, an early investor in Facebook and author 'Zucked,' joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Mark Zuckerberg's calls for the U.S. government to step in and regulate social media sites like Facebook.

data.title: Facebook's Breakout May Send Shares Sharply Higher
data.text: Facebook's stock is breaking out and may rise to about $187.

data.title: Facebook delivers ads based on race and gender stereotypes, researchers discover
data.text: A new study says the way Facebook's platform decides who should see an ad can skew ad delivery in ways advertisers don't intend.

data.title: Social media execs will face jail in Australia if their platforms host violent content
data.text: Attorney General Christian Porter said Thursday that the new penalty regime would target social media firms and clamp down on the circulation of content that broadcasts violent crimes.

data.title: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg Says Problems Will Take Years to Fix
data.text: Researchers at UpGuard found troves of user information hiding in plain sight on Amazon’s cloud computing servers.

data.title: Zuckerberg resists pressure to alter Facebook's livestream feature after Christchurch attacks
data.text: Facebook came under fire in recent weeks after a video of the attack in Christchurch, which killed 50 people, was livestreamed and widely circulated on its platform.

data.title: Facebook stock gains after Guggenheim upgrade
data.text: Shares of Facebook Inc. are up 1.3% in Thursday morning trading after Guggenheim analyst Michael Morris upgraded the stock to buy from neutral.

data.title: Facebook investors increasingly unfazed by 'content and privacy concerns,' analyst says in upgrade
data.text: Guggenheim raised its rating of Facebook's stock to buy from neutral on Thursday, as shareholders are becoming more accustomed to data leaks and privacy uncertainty.
